intro: Cardamine panatohea, commonly known as the Panamá watercress, is a small, herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as along stream banks and in forest understories. Its leaves are finely divided and have a peppery, slightly spicy aroma, similar to that of watercress. It is valued for its edible leaves and is sometimes cultivated for culinary purposes.
